thread.title: Chance the Rapper Plots Massive Spring Tour
thread.title_full: Chance the Rapper Plots Massive Spring Tour

title: Chance the Rapper Plots Massive Spring Tour

organizations.name: va @ veterans united home loans amphitheaterjune

text:
Chance the Rapper Plots Massive Spring Tour Following Grammy victories, rapper plots arena shows, festival stops Chance the Rapper will play a mix of arenas and festivals on a three-month tour that begins in April. Credit: Tim Mosenfelder/Getty 
Chance the Rapper will embark on a sprawling North American tour this spring in support of his Grammy-winning album, Coloring Book . Related What Chance the Rapper's Streaming-Only Grammy Nod Means for Pop Historic 'Coloring Book' nomination signals a larger shift in how music is consumed – and created 
The trek kicks off April 24th at Valley View in San Diego and stretches through May, wrapping June 17th with a set at the Firefly Music Festival in Dover, Delaware. Chance will play several festivals during his arena tour, including stops at Hangout in Gulf Shores, Alabama, Sasquatch in Seattle, Governors Ball and Bonnaroo . Chance also has an October 3rd show scheduled at the Hollywood Bowl in Los Angeles. 
Chance's tour announcement comes just days after the Chicago MC delivered a euphoric performance at the Grammys and picked up three awards, Best New Artist, Best Rap Performance for "No Problem" and Best Rap Album for Coloring Book . The wins ushered in a new era for the Grammys, which nominated the digital-only Coloring Book amidst a new rule change that made streaming-only albums eligible, where in the past only traditionally released, physical albums were considered. 
Chance the Rapper Tour Dates April 24 – San Diego, CA @ Valley ViewApril 26 – Oakland, CA @ Oracle ArenaApril 27 – Sacramento, CA @ Golden 1 CenterApril 29 – Salt Lake City, UT @ MaverikApril 30 – Boise, ID @ Idaho CenterMay 2 – Denver, CO @ Red RocksMay 5 – Dallas, TX @ JMBLYAMay 6 – Austin, TX @ JMBLYAMay 7 – Houston, TX @ Cynthia Woods Mitchell PavillionMay 9 – Tulsa, OK @ Bok CenterMay 10 – Omaha, NE @ CenturyLink Center OmahaMay 12 – St. Paul, MN @ Xcel Energy CenterMay 13 – Kansas City, KS @ Providence Medical Center AmphitheaterMay 14 – St. Louis, MO @ Scottrade CenterMay 16 – Columbus, OH @ Nationwide ArenaMay 18 – Detroit, MI @ The Palace in Auburn HillsMay 19 – Cleveland, OH @ Blossom Music CenterMay 20 – Pittsburgh, PA @ PPG Paints ArenaMay 21 – Gulf Shores, AL @ Hangout FestivalMay 24 – Toronto, Ontario @ Budweiser StageMay 25 – Montreal, Quebec @ Bell CentreMay 26 – Boston, MA @ Boston CallingMay 28 – Seattle, WA @ SasquatchMay 31 – Buffalo, NY @ Darien Lake Performing Arts CenterJune 2 – New York, NY @ Governor's BallJune 3 – Virginia Beach, VA @ Veterans United Home Loans AmphitheaterJune 4 – Washington, DC @ Jiffy Lube LiveJune 6 – Baltimore, MD @ Royal Farms ArenaJune 7 – Greensboro, NC @ Greensboro Coliseum ComplexJune 8 – Charlotte, NC @ PNC Music PavillionJune 10 – Manchester, TN @ BonnarooJune 11 – Atlanta, GA @ Lakewood AmphitheaterJune 13 – Miami, FL @ American Airlines ArenaJune 14 – Tampa, FL @ Amalie ArenaJune 16 – Eau Claire, WI @ Eaux Claires FestivalJune 17 – Dover, DE @ Firefly Music FestivalOctober 3 – Los Angeles, CA @ Hollywood Bowl More News
